data.title: The Simple Key To Human Connection & We’re Using It Wrong
data.meta_description: You probably would never admit to it but we are always looking for a human connection. We want to be understood by others. We choose our friends based on how well their interests correlate with ours…
data.text:
You probably would never admit to it but we are always looking for a human connection. We want to be understood by others.

Think about it.

We choose our friends based on how well their interests correlate with ours. Our favorite brands always seem to have exactly what we want. Even when going to the barber shop or the salon we go to a certain chair because that person is the only one that knows how to do it exactly how we want it.

But connections like these are hard to come by. And I suspect many of you may be frustrated with the lack of connection you have with classmates, coworkers, or even the opposite sex.

It’s not like you want them to be your friend, per se, you just want someone to have interesting conversations with on a random Tuesday afternoon.

However, the reality is most of us are looking for this interaction in our DMs instead of having a real conversation; face to face. You remember those right?

They used to be so good to have but social media has led us to think we can create that same connection through our mobile devices.

Wrong.
